It is the WORST feeling.
Seeing birthdays on Facebook is great, unless youâ€™re one of the many people who have essentially stopped using Facebook.
And between new phones, email calendars, lost backups, or just â€“ *gestures everywhere* â€“ life itself, itâ€™s easy to let something get in between you and the special day for someone you care about.

Next, there are the people you would call or send a happy birthday card to. Finally the â€œoh sh*tâ€ people that you can absolutely, positively NOT forget their birthdays.
Please see the very informative chart below.
Facebook DM or Text: The â€œhappy day after your birthdayâ€ message
For the first circle, your journey is going to be a little bit easier. â€œSorry we missed your birthdayâ€ is a lot easier to say to a friend you see occasionally than it is to say when you forgot your girlfriends birthday.
These are the kind of people that you can send a text or dm saying â€œhappy day after your birthdayâ€ or â€œI hope you had a great birthdayâ€ because you are still taking the time to recognize their birthday and let them know that you are thinking of them, even if you didnâ€™t happen to think of them on their actual birthday.
Theyâ€™ll appreciate the thought and likely will be able to spend more time replying than they would on their actual birthday because they arenâ€™t inundated with so many messages.

To put it simply, belated means something is late or delayed, like your amazon order or your one friend with ADHD who can never show up on time, and is the Emily Post approved way of saying â€œsorry for the late birthday wishesâ€.
So now youâ€™ve got your belated birthday card (or you can send just a regular birthday card and let them know in your message that yes, this is a better late than never happy birthday, weâ€™ll link our favorites below) and youâ€™re wondering what to write in a belated birthday card.

The key here is that this is still a card for them and to them.

We love to write about a favorite memory, story, or even just tell them what you like about them.

Now that we know what to say in a belated birthday card, letâ€™s move on to the next circle where weâ€™ll discuss how to make up for forgetting a birthday.
How to Make Up for Forgetting a Birthday â€“ Thoughtful Options for Your Inner Circle aka the â€œOh Sh*tâ€ tier
Weâ€™ve reached the â€œoh sh*tâ€ circle of birthday forgetting. Like, â€œI forgot my wifes birthdayâ€ bad.
This is the kind of forgetting that is going to take some explaining.
Luckily, for this instance only, we are living in an EXTREMELY long unprecedented time and historical event. Things are tough right now, for everyone. We are all having to save space for the people we love who are also struggling with the pandemic and everything else. This is the time when youâ€™ll be asking for that space and that forgiveness.
Again, be honest. Let them know that you screwed up and you are sorry. Weâ€™d advise against long, drawn-out excuses. They donâ€™t want to hear about the long conference at work, the traffic, or the dissociative state youâ€™ve been in. They probably already know and hopefully will consider that!
thoughtful gifts for your closest people
